Posts.Content: Thank you for replying that does make me feel better. My epilepsy is not controlled but I only have monthly or so partial seizures. My epilepsy consultant says go ahead with the chemo but your reply has really helped Dawn
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and epilepsy

Posts.Content: I am trying to decide whether to have chemo for my breast cancer as well as the radiotherapy and hormone therapy. I had a brain tumour some years ago which left me with epilepsy and am worried that the chemo may increase the severity of my seizures. Does anyone have any experience of this?
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and epilepsy

Posts.Content: Making this decision is so hard. I am 50 and Have just had a wide local excision of my DCIS which turned out to be grade 2 invasive and had already spread to a lymph node. I did not want a mastectomy and the surgeon reassured me that as long as he got clear margins which thank fully he did if I had radiotherapy the rate of recurrence and survival is as good as a mastectomy. It is a very personal thing but a hard choice. Dawn
